p: Micro-planning helps peer educators transition from being passive data gatherers to active site managers who analyse data from their spots and networks. Such information is used by PEs to follow up with KPs they are responsible for, understand their risks and vulnerabilities and plan outreach and services based on their needs. [ 22]. Micro-planning has been used extensively in Kenya and in India [ 21â€“ 24]. With support from BMGF, PEPFAR and other donors, micro-planning methods are being adapted and applied elsewhere [ 25].
